faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course introduces mathematical methods used in models of economics and knowing of which is needed for understanding of economics textbooks and scientific articles, with no need for a preceding higher mathematics course. Mathematical methods considered are illustrated with the examples form economics. The aim of the course is not a perfect analysis and interpretation of models used as an example, the latter will be the topic of further courses.
description.et: Kursus tutvustab teoreetilistes majandusmudelites kasutatavaid matemaatilisi meetodeid, mille tundmine on vajalik majandusteaduslike õpikute ning teadusartiklite mõistmiseks, eeldamata kõrgema matemaatika kursuse läbimist. Käsitletavate matemaatiliste meetodite kasutusvõimalusi majandusteaduses illustreerivad näited majandusteooriast. Sealjuures ei ole eesmärgiks näitena kasutatud majandusmudelite täielik analüüs ja tõlgendamine, viimast tehakse järgmiste kursuste käigus.

objectives.en: The course provides practical examples of using mathematical methods in economic models.
objectives.et: Kursus annab kogemuse, kuidas kasutada matemaatilisi meetodeid majandusteoreetilistes mudelites.

learning_outcomes.en: Student, who has passed the course
* knows different mathematical methods (differentiating, integrating, optimizing) and possibilities to use these methods for analysing economical models;
learning_outcomes.et: * tunneb erinevaid matemaatilisi meetodeid (diferentseerimine, integreerimine, optimeerimine) ja nende kasutusvõimalusi majandusmudelite analüüsimisel;

learning_outcomes.en: * is able to present problems of economics as a verbal model and to set up a mathematical model on the basis of verbal model;
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab majandusteoorias ette tulevaid probleeme esitada verbaalse mudelina ning selle põhjal püstitada matemaatilise mudeli;

learning_outcomes.en: * is able to present mathematical model in graphic form;
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab matemaatilise mudeli esitada ka graafilisel kujul;

learning_outcomes.en: * is able to choose an appropriate mathematical method for analysing the model and to use this method;
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab valida mudeli analüüsimiseks sobiva matemaatilise meetodi ning seda kasutada;

learning_outcomes.en: * is able to interpret the results of the analysis

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade is based on the results of two classroom tests. Each test has a weight of 50% from the final grade. The tests cannot be retaken. 
If a student fails to pass the course based on these two tests, then she/he has to take a resit exam (during an exam session) with weight 100% covering all the topics. The points from the classroom tests will not be considered to make up for any part of the resit exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
